intro: Jacquemontia linoides var. major, commonly known as the showy morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces large, showy flowers with five petals, typically in shades of blue to purple. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and grows along the ground, often in wet or disturbed soils. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other morning glories. Its rapid growth and attractive blooms make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening, though it can be invasive in some areas.
